intro: Sphacele chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sphacele chilensis is also known for its ability to store water in its tissues, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
